title: Grading the blockbuster stunner that sends Rafael Devers to the Giants
content: The Red Sox stunned the baseball world Sunday, trading their $313.5 million All-Star to San Francisco.

title: The 7 MLB execs under the most pressure at the trade deadline
content: With the July 31 deadline, here are the front offices that could make or break their future this trade season.

title: Red Sox deal All-Star Devers to Giants in stunner
content: The Giants are sending Jordan Hicks, Kyle Harrison, outfield prospect James Tibbs III and pitching prospect Jose Bello to the Red Sox for Rafael Devers.

title: Spaun captures first major title, wins U.S. Open
content: J.J. Spaun, 34, who started Sunday one stroke behind 54-hole leader Sam Burns, survived a terrible start and challenging elements to pull away from the pack and capture his first major title with a two-stroke win in the U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club.

title: Ohtani to return to mound vs. Padres on Monday
content: Shohei Ohtani will make his long-awaited return to pitching Monday night in a matchup against the division-rival San Diego Padres.

title: Grizzlies send Bane to Magic in blockbuster trade
content: The Grizzlies traded Desmond Bane to the Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four unprotected first-round picks and one first-round pick swap.

title: USMNT ends skid, nets 5 in Gold Cup opening win
content: Malik Tillman scored twice as the United States built a three-goal, first-half lead and ended a four-game losing streak by routing Trinidad and Tobago 5-0 on Sunday in a Concacaf Gold Cup opener.

title: Sky's Reese 2nd youngest to record triple-double
content: Angel Reese had 11 points, 11 assists and 13 rebounds for her first career triple-double in the Sky's 78-66 win over the Sun on Sunday.

title: Judge 1-for-12 as NY swept: Got to swing at strikes
content: Aaron Judge blamed himself for swinging at pitches outside the strike zone as the Yankees were swept in a three-game series at the Red Sox.

title: Braves lose, waste Holmes' 15-strikeout effort
content: Atlanta starter Grant Holmes pitched five hitless innings and ended with a career-best 15 strikeouts on Sunday afternoon, but the Braves faltered in the end, dropping a 10-1 decision to the Colorado Rockies, a loss that dropped them to 31-39 this season.

title: ✍  Deals NBA stars should get this summer
content: A $125 million deal for Giddey? Who could give $80 million to Kuminga? See what our resident GM is offering 10 star free agents.

title: How J.J. Spaun battled Oakmont, rain and bad breaks for a U.S. Open title
content: Oakmont was almost unplayable Sunday afternoon in the rain. But in the end, it was exactly what Spaun needed to become one of the unlikeliest U.S. Open champions.

title: Inside the 7 plays defining these back-and-forth NBA Finals
content: Through four NBA Finals games, OKC and Indiana are separated by just six total points. These plays can help uncover why.

title: What Sunday's shocking trade means for the East, the KD saga and the NBA draft
content: Sunday's shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

title: Grading the Bane trade between Orlando and Memphis
content: The NBA offseason is almost here, and deals are already underway. Catch up on the latest trade grades.

title: Malik Tillman shines as USMNT secures a much-needed win
content: Tillman was the USMNT's best player as Mauricio Pochettino’s team bounced back from a rough week to open its Gold Cup play with a victory.

title: How a bucket-list MCWS trip turned into reality for Arkansas' Bash Braddahs
content: For five months, the Aloys have been making noise in Arkansas. Now their talent and journey is on full display.

title: Panthers within one win of a Cup repeat: Grades for both teams, outlook for Game 6
content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

title: The Liberty won their first WNBA title last year; here's why they're even better now
content: Their perfect season ended Saturday, but the defending champs might be better than last year, with one notable weakness.

title: Are Real Madrid ready to begin the Xabi Alonso era at the Club World Cup?
content: Xabi Alonso needs to hit the ground running at Real Madrid, with the Club World Cup starting just three weeks after he was hired as coach.

title: Poch: U.S. needed win after losses, recent 'noise'
content: SAN JOSE, Calif. -- United States coach Mauricio Pochettino welcomed the positives vibes from a tournament-opening 5-0 Gold Cup win over Trinidad and Tobago at PayPal Park that snapped a recent four-game losing streak.

title: Lloris: Spurs must build on Europa League win
content: Hugo Lloris believes his former club Tottenham have lifted a weight off their shoulders after winning the Europa League, and must build on from it.

title: Delap challenged to earn No. 9 after Chelsea move
content: Enzo Maresca believes Liam Delap has the potential to become England's main striker, but warned the 22-year-old he faces a fight to get into the Chelsea line-up first.

title: Musiala nets hat trick, Bayern hit 10 to start CWC
content: Bayern Munich began their Club World Cup campaign in emphatic fashion with a ruthless 10-0 demolition of Auckland City on Sunday, as Jamal Musiala marked his return from injury with a brilliant second-half hat trick in a commanding team display.

title: PSG 'hungry' to add Club World Cup to UCL win
content: Luis Enrique said his Paris Saint-Germain team are "hungry" to add the Club World Cup to their Champions League success, after beating Atlético Madrid 4-0 in the opening game in Group B.

title: Italy great Gattuso named country's new coach
content: Former midfield great Gennaro Gattuso has been appointed as Italy's new head coach following Luciano Spalletti exit from the national team.

title: Angel City wear shirts supporting 'immigrant city'
content: Angel City, the NWSL team based in Los Angeles, distributed T-shirts to fans on Saturday that proclaimed "Immigrant City Football Club."

title: Don't be surprised if ... these 19 things happen in 2025
content: In fantasy, you don't draft last year's stats, which is why it's important to be forward-thinking. Eric Karabell offers his thoughts on players who could delight or disappoint in 2025.

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: McLaren feared disharmony, but Norris' contrition will go a long way
content: Sunday was the lowest point of his season so far, but Lando Norris faced the situation with a refreshing honesty not often seen at the top level of motor racing.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins Cup race at Mexico City
content: Shane van Gisbergen once again mastered a new track to win NASCAR's first Cup Series points-paying race outside the United States in the modern era.

title: Carlota Ciganda takes LPGA Classic; first win in eight years
content: Carlota Ciganda birdied the final two holes to win the Meijer LPGA Classic on Sunday for her first LPGA Tour victory in more than 8 1/2 years.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out
content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

title: KKCCI seeks Pralhad Joshi’s intervention in ensuring regional development push
content: A memorandum highlights key concerns and calls for the Centre’s action on industrial, agricultural and infrastructure development in the region

title: From Vaastu to AI, Asutosh College launches 25 courses to boost employability
content: Skill-oriented certificate programmes open to students across West Bengal; offered in blended mode by college faculty

title: Tiruchi Corporation takes steps to help homeless people at night shelters to earn a livelihood
content: Plans are afoot to establish new shelters for those with good mental and physical health at Tiruverumbur, Woraiyur, and Srirangam at a cost of ₹1 crore each under the National Urban Livelihood Mission

title: Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurates Water Efficient Thrissur (WET) project
content: 9,000 households in Ollur zone have already been equipped with pipelines under the project. The entire system is digitally monitored in real-time, allowing immediate detection of leaks, illegal usage, or supply disruptions

title: APCO and Lepakshi launch Statewide design contest from June 17
content: Competition is open to all residents of the State above the age of 18, be it artisans, students, designers, or independent creators; ₹5 lakh total cash prize to be awarded to 30 winners

title: Modi govt's negligence in not giving priority to aviation sector safety worrying: Congress
content: "53% posts are vacant in DGCA; 35% posts vacant in BCAS; 17% posts vacant in AAI," says Jairam Ramesh citing a media report

title: Stranded under the trees, fishing families t Chinna Kottaimedu near Sirkazhi live in constant fear of losing their houses
content: Despite the restrictions, residents continue to pay taxes and hold valid ration cards. Those without pattas are in limbo as the land falls under the forest category even after decades of continuous habitation

title: YSRCP levelling baseless allegations on Talliki Vandanam scheme, says Anantapur MP
content: “The party leaders failed to prove their charges that ₹2,000 of each Talliki Vandanam beneficiary is going into the pockets of HRD Minister Nara Lokesh”

title: Grand Anicut Canal to be widened and developed: T.N. CM Stalin
content: The Uyyakondan Extension canal in Thanjavur district too to be renovated and a  bridge will be constructed near Thenperambur at the Vennar-Vettar branch off point, says Chief Minister

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation considering poultry waste transport in its own vehicles to prevent dumping
content: Final decision will be made only after considering cost factors as well as practical issues of managing the transport

title: Bengaluru: Rapido bike taxi driver booked for slapping woman customer
content: The victim, a private firm employee, objected to the driver’s rash and negligent riding, leading to a heated argument.

title: PM Modi leaves for Canada to attend G7 summit after concluding Cyprus visit
content: PM Modi will arrive in Calgary at the invitation of Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, to attend the G7 summit in Kananaskis. This is Mr. Modi's first visit to Canada in a decade.

title: Sonam honeymoon murder: Victim’s kin demand narco test on Sonam’s parents, brother
content: The victim’s elder brother, Vipin Raghuvanshi, demanded that people who posted these videos on social media also be questioned and asked why they had not released the footage earlier

title: Yogandhra campaign reflects State’s vision of a healthier A.P., says Minister
content: Regular practice of Yoga even for half-an-hour a day can significantly improve both physical and mental well-being, Minister for Backward Classes Welfare S. Savitha said

title: T.N. Governor has not changed despite Supreme Court verdict, is sitting on Kalaignar University Bill: CM Stalin
content: Even after 40 days, Governor has not given his assent till now, despite several reminders, Mr. Stalin said. “We will wait with patience; if we run out of patience, we will force the Governor to give in,” the Chief Minister asserted.

title: ED files chargesheet against Pakistani who made Indian government IDs for Bangaldeshis in Kolkata
content: The ED said it has submitted the prosecution complaint against the man named Ajad Mallik alias Ahammed Hossain Azad and Azad Hossain before a special Prevention of Money Laundering (PMLA) court in Kolkata on June 13

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: On BJMC foundation day, sombre mood on campus coping with grief
content: The BJMC, one of the oldest medical colleges in India, has been the epicentre of action following the June 12 crash, which killed 241 people on board and 29 on the ground, including five MBBS students.

title: Over 1.5 lakh persons from Vizianagaram, Srikakulam expected to take part international yoga day celebrations at RK Beach of Visakhapatnam
content: Participants  are being advised to travel by the transport facility being organised by the government

title: 'Couldn't happen without money': FATF condemns Pahalgam terror attack
content: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has condemned the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, emphasizing the need for increased scrutiny of countries' efforts to combat terror financing. India is preparing a detailed dossier on Pakistan's alleged violations of anti-money laundering and terror financing guidelines, aiming to push for its re-inclusion in FATF's "grey list.

title: Israel attacks Gaza aid again: 34 Palestinians killed
content: Tragedy struck Gaza as at least 34 Palestinians were killed in shootings near food distribution centres, marking the deadliest incident yet. The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF)-operated centres have become increasingly dangerous, with witnesses reporting that Israeli troops opened fire to control crowds at the Rafah site. While the Israeli military hasn't commented on Monday's deaths, they previously cited warning shots at individuals approaching military positions.

title: Heavy rains in Mumbai: Red alert for Raigad; trains and flight services hit
content: The India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for Raigad, Pune, and Satara districts, warning of extremely heavy rainfall. Mumbai is under an orange alert as persistent showers caused waterlogging and disrupted transportation. Since June 1st, rain-related incidents have tragically claimed 18 lives in Maharashtra, with 65 others injured.

title: Beware! BCCI cracks down: New bone test rule to catch over-age players
content: The BCCI has introduced a new rule for junior cricketers in the Under-16 category, allowing a second bone test if the '+1 factor' makes them ineligible. This aims to ensure accurate age determination, preventing players from missing a season due to arithmetical calculations rather than scientific assessment.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: To circumvent US AI chip restrictions, Chinese firms are creatively processing data abroad, exemplified by engineers transporting hard drives to Malaysian data centers for AI model training. Southeast Asia is becoming a strategic hub with rapidly expanding data-center capacity, while the Middle East also attracts Chinese AI developers, highlighting the challenges of enforcing US export controls.

title: Board Member. Preacher. Assassin? The twisted life of Minnesota shooter
content: Boelter, who remains on the run, had been appointed multiple times to the Minnesota Workforce Development Board, a 41-member body advising the governor on job creation and economic policy. Public records confirm he served alongside Senator Hoffman and even participated in a virtual meeting with him in 2022 to discuss pandemic-era labour issues. Authorities say it is still unclear how well the two knew each other.

title: Pune bridge story: How years of neglect and overcrowding sparked disaster
content: A tragic bridge collapse near Pune's Kund Mala claimed four lives, including a child, and injured over 50. The decades-old bridge, already deemed unsafe and closed, buckled under the weight of more than 100 people, ignoring warning signs. Investigations are underway to determine administrative lapses, while compensation has been announced for the victims' families.

title: Jobs in AI era: LinkedIn founder to Gen Z graduates; You will become 'enormously attractive' if...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman encourages young people to embrace AI as a tool for job hunting, viewing them as "AI natives" who can help older professionals adapt.

title: Watch: 'One-third of Iranian regime's missile launchers dismantled', claims Israel
content: Tensions escalate as the IDF claims to have dismantled a third of Iran's missile launchers in response to uranium enrichment concerns. Iran accuses Israel of widening the conflict by targeting a key gas facility, South Pars, critical for domestic supply. Retaliatory missile barrages have resulted in casualties on both sides, raising fears of regional and global escalation.

title: Watch: Nicosia council member touches PM Modi's feet
content: During Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Cyprus, Michaela Kythreoti Mhlapa, a council member of Nicosia, demonstrated her respect by touching his feet at the historic Centre of Nicosia. This area, known for its Venetian fortifications and cultural significance, served as the backdrop for the Prime Minister's welcome. The Centre represents the city's rich heritage.

title: Kashmir: Blast reported at Kupwara mosque site during demolition drive
content: An explosion in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district injured three individuals, including a young boy. The incident took place during the demolition of an old mosque structure by the mosque management committee for a new construction. The injured were promptly hospitalized, with one person requiring further treatment at a specialized medical facility.

title: Telecom giant to cut 55,000 jobs: CEO says AI could deepen cuts
content: BT Group's CEO, Allison Kirkby, suggests AI advancements could lead to deeper job cuts beyond the already planned 55,000 by 2030. The company is also considering a potential spin-off of its Openreach broadband network, valued at £30 billion, to address its underrepresentation in BT's share price. Kirkby's streamlining efforts have boosted investor confidence.

title: Middle East on edge: Iran signals strategic shift on nuclear commitments; mulls NPT exit
content: Amid escalating tensions and Israeli strikes, Iran considers withdrawing from the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT). Iranian parliamentarians are drafting a bill to this effect, prompted by recent attacks and an IAEA resolution. While reiterating its peaceful nuclear intentions, Iran criticizes Israel's undeclared nuclear arsenal and non-signatory status to the NPT.

title: Watch: New video shows AI crash survivor emerging from burning wreckage
content: A newly surfaced video shows Vishwash Kumar Ramesh, the lone survivor of the devastating Air India AI 171 crash near Ahmedabad, being led away from the wreckage. The flight, carrying 242 passengers and crew, crashed shortly after takeoff on June 12, killing 241 onboard and later claiming the lives of 33 more on the ground.

title: Wayne Gretzky caught in backlash; Trump calls him ‘a free agent’; Canadians question his loyalty
content: Wayne Gretzky, a Canadian icon, faces backlash for his association with Donald Trump, particularly after Trump's remarks about Canada. Critics question Gretzky's Canadian identity, fueled by images of him at Trump events. Despite Gretzky's attempts to remain neutral, his silence on Trump's policies and his wife's social media activity have intensified the controversy, potentially impacting his legacy in Canada.

title: IND vs ENG: Why Gautam Gambhir left England - A timeline of his absence and return
content: Gautam Gambhir, India's head coach, is set to rejoin the national squad on June 17 in England, just before the first Test against England. He had returned to India on June 12 due to his mother's heart attack. In his absence, assistant coaches managed the team's preparations, including an intra-squad match.

title: 'Earlier, I used to beat Indians at will': What global chess stars say about India's dominance
content: Gukesh Dommaraju's rise to world chess champion at 18 has sparked a chess revolution, validating Garry Kasparov's prediction. At the Delhi International Open, seasoned players like GM Tornike Sanikidze noted the fierce competition from India's young talents. Veteran Rani Hamid acknowledged India's significant progress in chess. India is now a dominant force, driven by ambitious young players.

title: Iran-Israel conflict impact: Basmati rice prices to drop; Iran may cut import
content: Basmati rice prices, recently elevated due to increased exports, are anticipated to decline due to potential export reductions to Iran amidst geopolitical tensions. Iran constitutes a significant importer of Indian basmati rice.

title: Rapido rider attacks woman passenger; viral video triggers outrage
content: In Bengaluru's Jayanagar, a Rapido bike taxi rider slapped a woman passenger after she stopped the ride due to rash driving and refused to pay. The incident, captured on video and widely circulated online, shows the rider assaulting the woman, causing her to fall. Following the assault, the woman has filed a police complaint at the Jayanagar police station.

title: 'She was fidgety': Taylor Swift’s shy reaction to Travis Kelce question
content: Amidst Travis Kelce's NFL training in Florida, Taylor Swift's recent visit to a Miami children's hospital has sparked buzz. Her shy reaction when mentioning her boyfriend, Kelce, charmed fans, fueling speculation about their relationship. While enjoying quality time, including a Stanley Cup Playoffs appearance, rumors of a potential engagement are circulating, with sources suggesting they're committed to a future together.

title: 'Barak Magen': Israel uses new air defence system against Iran
content: In a first, the Israeli Navy successfully deployed its Barak Magen air defense system, intercepting Iranian drones. Eight drones were neutralized by Sa’ar 6-class missile corvettes patrolling Israeli waters. This marked the operational debut of the Barak Magen and its LRAD interceptor.

title: RBI rate cut effect: SBI slashes lending rates by up to 50 bps
content: State Bank of India reduced its lending rates by 50 basis points, effective June 15, 2025, lowering RLLR to 7.75% and EBLR to 8.15%. Fixed deposit rates for amounts up to Rs 3 crore were also decreased by 25 basis points across various maturities.

title: Electronics boom ahead! India's production may hit $282–500 billion by 2030
content: India's electronics manufacturing sector is poised for significant growth, potentially reaching $282 billion to $500 billion by 2030, driven by global supply chain shifts and increasing domestic production. Mobile phones, semiconductors, and consumer electronics are expected to be key growth drivers. Realizing this potential requires sustained policy support, infrastructure development, and strategic investments.

title: 'Itni goliyaan maarungi ki...': Woman points gun at CNG station staff in UP; watch
content: In Hardoi, Uttar Pradesh, Ariba Khan brandished her father's licensed revolver at a CNG station employee after an argument over safety protocols. The confrontation escalated when the employee, Rajnish Kumar, insisted the family exit their car before refueling, leading to threats and a police investigation. Authorities have seized the weapon and are pursuing legal action against the family.

title: 'Not an era of war': PM Modi urges peace amid West Asia tensions
content: Narendra Modi received Cyprus's highest honor, the Grand Cross of the Order of Makarios III. He stated that the award represents respect for India and strong Cyprus-India relations. The award recognizes contributions to Cyprus or humanity. Modi's visit is the first by an Indian Prime Minister in over twenty years.

title: ‘Virat Kohli tougher than Sachin Tendulkar’: James Anderson names his hardest opponent from fab four
content: England's legendary bowler James Anderson reflected on his battles with modern cricket's finest. Anderson named Virat Kohli as the toughest batter he faced, even more so than Sachin Tendulkar. Kohli retired from Test cricket in May 2025 with 9230 runs. Anderson's praise highlights Kohli's technical skill and resilience. Their rivalry was marked by respect and strategic adjustments.

title: Watch: Iran missiles seen streaking across Jerusalem skies
content: Tensions escalate as Iranian missiles target Jerusalem, prompting strong Israeli response. An Israeli minister accuses Iran's Supreme Leader of ordering attacks on civilians, while officials claim air superiority over Tehran. Netanyahu announces Operation Rising Lion to neutralize Iran's nuclear capabilities, as Khamenei vows retaliation, escalating the conflict.

title: 'For 1.4 billion Indians': Cyprus confers highest honour on PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was honoured with Cyprus' highest civilian award, the Grand Cross of the Order of Makarios III, which he dedicated to the 1.4 billion people of India. This visit marks the first by an Indian PM since 2002 and gains importance due to Cyprus' ongoing conflict with Turkey.

title: Science: Unique rare Earth elements unveiled on an underwater island
content: Researchers discovered a hidden island near Rio Grande. The island has abundant rare earth elements. This finding could revolutionize green technology. Scientists believe the island was once part of a large tropical landmass. The site may hold evidence of past human habitation. Further research will explore the island's history and composition. This discovery could transform natural resource acquisition.

title: Honeymoon murder: Trekker shares last vid of Raja Raghuvanshi with Sonam
content: A tourist's video may hold key evidence in Raja Raghuvanshi's murder case. The video shows Raja and Sonam on their honeymoon in Meghalaya. Dev Singh, the tourist, unknowingly recorded them near a living root bridge. Sonam and others are accused of plotting Raja's murder. Police investigation continues to build a strong case against the accused.

title: Big e-Aadhaar revamp! No more photocopies required; check top steps
content: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) is set to revamp e-Aadhaar, introducing a QR code-based system to eliminate need for physical copies. Updates, excluding biometrics, will be automated through integrated databases, reducing center visits.

title: 'You destroyed them': Yograj Singh claims BCCI wanted to sack MS Dhoni
content: Yograj Singh has criticized the BCCI selectors from the early 2010s for allegedly mishandling the careers of senior players after the 2011 World Cup victory. He claims key players like Gautam Gambhir, Yuvraj Singh, and others were unfairly sidelined following poor overseas tours.

title: Ind vs Eng: Without Virat and Rohit, who will be India's best bet with bat?
content: India's Test tour of England marks a generational shift as KL Rahul, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Shubman Gill shoulder the batting responsibilities in the absence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Rahul aims for consistency, while Jaiswal faces his biggest challenge yet.

title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised due to stomach ailments: Doc says she's stable
content: Sonia Gandhi, the 78-year-old Congress Parliamentary Party Chairperson, is in stable condition at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, where she is being treated for a stomach ailment since Sunday evening. Prior to her hospitalization, she had a medical check-up on June 9 and underwent tests in Shimla for elevated blood pressure, where doctors reported her condition as stable.

title: IND vs ENG: The series that lasted a year - Why India's 2021 tour was halted midway
content: The 2021 India-England Test series saw intense battles and a rare disruption, with the final Test delayed by a year due to COVID-19. It resumed in 2022, ending 2-2, and remains a symbol of resilience amid global uncertainty.

title: Gold rate today: Gold prices at record high of Rs 1.01L; what’s the outlook?
content: Gold rate today: Gold prices surged to a record high of Rs 1,01,078 per 10 grams, driven by global equity pressures and rising crude oil prices. Silver futures also remained stable near peak levels. Analysts suggest that geopolitical tensions and a weakening dollar index are influencing precious metal prices, advising caution and adherence to specified trading levels.

title: K'taka Bike taxi ban: Rapido says it 'paused' services; Ola, Uber continue
content: Karnataka's ban on bike taxis is now in effect following a High Court order. Rapido has paused its bike taxi services, introducing 'Bike Parcel' instead. Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy warned of strict action against non-compliant aggregators. While Uber and Ola continued offering bike taxi services, the Transport Department maintains that using private vehicles for commercial purposes is illegal

title: Mid-air scare: Air India's Delhi-bound flight returns to Hong Kong
content: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner, flight AI-315, en route to Delhi from Hong Kong, was compelled to return to Hong Kong airport on Monday morning due to a suspected technical malfunction detected mid-air.

title: US embassy damaged in Israel: Iran missiles strike Tel Aviv; comes after Trump's warning
content: The US Embassy in Israel sustained minor damage due to Iranian missile strikes near its Tel Aviv branch, confirmed the US Ambassador. While no injuries were reported among US personnel, the embassy and consulate will remain closed due to the ongoing security situation.

title: AI crash: 22 Boeing 787 Dreamliners inspected; 11 more to go after DGCA orders
content: Following a recent Air India Dreamliner crash after departing from Ahmedabad, the airline is performing enhanced inspections on its Boeing 787 fleet, as instructed by the DGCA.

title: Gautam Gambhir set to rejoin Team India on June 17 in England
content: While head coach Gautam Gambhir was away, India’s assistant coaches Sitanshu Kotak, Ryan ten Doeschate, and Morne Morkel took charge of the team for a four-day intra-squad game against India A in Beckenham.

title: MLS: Philly win to keep pressure on Vancouver at the top
content: Despite the Gold Cup and Club World Cup causing havoc, Philadelphia Union are eying top spot in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: NWSL: Can anyone stop Kansas City?
content: When the Current are firing on all cylinders, there's no stopping them. That and more in our latest rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye trio of free agents
content: Real Madrid eye a trio of targets, including Liverpool's Ibrahima Konate. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: Embassy continuously monitoring situation, engaging Indian students in Iran to ensure safety: MEA
content: The Indian embassies in Israel and Iran have issued advisories on their X handles in view of the situation.

title: Fresh caste survey as per law, says Karnataka CM
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said that the fresh socio-educational and economic survey had been taken up as there were objections from both the upper and downtrodden communities to the earlier survey

title: MP from Karnataka and wife were booked on ill-fated helicopter that crashed in Uttarakhand, but were told to take next chopper
content: Eeranna Kadadi, Rajya Sabha member from Karnataka, was part of a delegation of MPs that was in Uttarakhand

title: RBI relocates Andhra Pradesh regional office to Vijayawada
content: RBI Deputy Governor T. Rabi Sankar on June 16, 2025 inaugurated the new office of the Reserve Bank in Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh, the central bank said

title: Gazette notification on census 'damp squib'; silent on inclusion of caste: Congress
content: Congress criticises the 16th Census notification as a “damp squib” for lacking caste inclusion, urging Telangana model adoption

title: Threat call to SHAR turns hoax, search operation continues
content: The security agencies enhanced the search operations across the island campus, which is located 100km from the temple city of Tirupati

title: Rain in the Nilgiris leads to power outages, closure of schools and tourism spots
content: Holiday announced for schools in Udhagamandalam, Kundha, Gudalur and Pandalur taluks on June 16, 2025. Many popular tourist places remained shut.

title: India was always Hindu rashtra...what we want is a Hindu rashtra where food, education, healthcare is available to everyone, says VHP chief Praveen Togadia
content: Clarifying that India was already a ‘Hindu Rashtra’ and there was no need to make it so, Founder International President of Vishwa Hindu Parishad Dr. Praveen Togadia has said that they wanted a ‘Hindu Rashtra’ where food, education and healthcare was available to all children.

title: PM Modi holds delegation-level talks with Cyprus President Nikos Christodoulides
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was accorded a ceremonial welcome on his arrival at the Presidential Palace ahead of the talks.

title: 66 candidates mentored by Telangana ADG Mahesh Bhagwat among 459 selected in UPSC CAPF exam
content: The senior police officer credited the collective mentorship provided by a group of distinguished officers and experts

title: Caste census report could not be implemented due to opposition from some sections in Karnataka, regrets Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah
content: Addressing public meeting in Mandya, he called upon the gathering to introspect and support only leaders who fought for their rights

title: Pune bridge collapse: Police continue search operation; Fadnavis says Indrayani river bridge was declared dangerous
content: Search operation at collapsed iron bridge site in Pune continues; authorities say the iron structure collapsed due to overcrowding by tourists who ignored the warning board at the spot

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Ex-CM Rupani's mortal remains handed over to kin
content: The last rites of Rupani will be held in his hometown Rajkot after a funeral procession on Monday evening.

title: Five killed, 18 injured as pick-up van overturns in Bihar's Saran
content: According to locals, despite attempts to regain control, the vehicle veered off the road and overturned

title: Kedarnath helicopter crash: 2 senior officials of helicopter firm booked for negligence
content: The Bell 407 helicopter, which crashed due to bad weather in the forests of Gauri Mai Khark between Gaurikund and Triyuginarayan belonged to Aryan Aviation Private Limited

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: DNA tests identify 87 victims; 47 bodies handed over to kin
content: Earlier on June 15, samples of 250 victims, including persons on board the flight as well as those who were killed on the ground, have been collected for identification

title: India positioned to become world’s third-largest economy: PM Modi in Cyprus
content: PM Modi made the remarks as he attended a business roundtable on June 15 in Limassol, a city on the southern coast of Cyprus

title: Madras High Court summons MLA ‘Poovai’ Jagan Moorthy, ADGP Jayaram after they turn out to be suspects in abduction case
content: Justice P. Velmurugan orders that the MLA as well as the ADGP must be present in the court by afternoon since both were suspects in the crime

title: Bike taxi ban comes into effect in Karnataka, but some aggregators continue to operate
content: Thousands of commuters lamented the shutting down of bike taxis, an affordable transport service especially in cities, following an order by the Karnataka High Court.

title: Delhi-bound Air India flight returns to Hong Kong after pilot suspects technical issue: Sources
content: “The flight has landed safely in Hong Kong, all passengers have disembarked and the aircraft is undergoing inspection,” sources said

title: Population Census will be conducted in 2027, government notifies
content: The Census will be conducted in two phases — ‘House Listing Operations’, and ‘Population Enumeration’; it will, for the first time, enumerate caste

title: Karnataka government issues draft notification increasing stilt parking height to 4.5 metres
content: The additional height will not be calculated for the height of the building for the purpose of property tax and other regulations

title: Rain continues to lash Kerala; orange alert for rivers as water level rises
content: Apart from heavy rain, gusty winds prevailing over Kerala, with Idukki recording wind speeds of 80 kmph

title: Leopard rescued by forest officials in Andhra
content: A bone reportedly got stuck in the leopard’s throat and veterinary doctors are attending to it, officials said

title: KTR appears before ACB in Formula-E Race case
content: The former Minister alleged that the Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy is mulling to get him arrested in the case

title: Few places receive light showers in Andhra
content: The IMD  had predicted isolated heavy rainfall for the region of North Coastal Andhra Pradesh until Monday

title: Heavy rain, gusty winds lash Kozhikode district of Kerala
content: Kozhikode on red alert. District Collector has declared a holiday for all educational institutions for Monday

title: 50-year-old biker dies after branch falls on him in Chikkamagaluru district of Karnataka
content: In another incident, a 100-year-old woman died and two others suffered injuries after a wall in a house collapsed during heavy rains in Shivamogga taluk

title: TMC's Abhishek criticises Centre for 'lack' of accountability over Pahalgam attack
content: Calling it a "massive breach in national security", Abhishek Banerjee asked who would take responsibility for the "failure"

title: Israel-Iran conflict: India starts relocating its citizens from Tehran to safer places within Iran, as Indian officials work on an evacuation plan
content: According to sources, buses have started relocating students from Tehran University of Medical Sciences, Islamic Azad University Tehran Medical Sciences, Iran University of Medical Sciences (Tehran)

title: Congress claims SEBI's Adani probe hampered by lack of information sharing by tax-haven countries
content: The Cyprus-based fund New Leaina has reportedly about $420 million in Adani companies, Cpngress claimed

title: Filmmaker missing after Ahmedabad plane crash; kin fear he may be among ground victims
content: The last known location of filmmaker Mahesh Kalawadia’s mobile phone was traced to just 700 metres away from the accident site

title: With monsoon rains, pothole menace makes a comeback with a vengeance in Bengaluru
content: Citizens have pointed out that filling potholes is not enough. What was needed was interventions to ensure the roads are not waterlogged with every rain.

title: Traffic diverted away from bridges as rain continues to lash north Karnataka
content: Parwad in Belagavi and Kodkani in Uttara Kannada have received more than 120 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours

title: Heavy rain batters Kannur, Kasaragod districts in Kerala; holiday declared for educational institutions
content: Authorities remain on high alert as water levels at Manjeswaram, Puthige, Madhur, and Uppala river gauge stations crossed danger marks on Monday morning

title: Boston Institute of Analytics opens centre in Hubballi
content: The institute’s first centre in north Karnataka is all set to offer courses in data sciences, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and allied fields starting July 1

title: Three-year-old dies after ambulance stuck in massive traffic jam in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Officials say traffic congestion was caused by temple festival at Kottiyoor which saw a huge influx of devotees over the weekend

title: Cute new additions in Visakhapatnam zoo: Wallaby joey and mouse deer
content: Wallaby joey and mouse deer fawn add to the growing zoo family in Visakhapatnam’s Indira Gandhi Zoological Park

title: Monsoon escapes: Discover four stunning waterfalls in Andhra Pradesh’s Eastern Ghats
content: We journey through the waterfalls of the Eastern Ghats where rain-fed streams turn into natural marvels during the monsoon

title: Pune bridge collapse: Congress demands accountability, calls for questions to be asked of those in power
content: Each life lost in this avoidable disaster is a painful reminder of the cost of neglect, Pawan Khera said, adding that public safety should not be an afterthought.

title: India weather news LIVE: IMD issues orange alert for Mumbai, Thane, Palghar; red alert for Raigad
content: The Met Department has issued a red alert predicting extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places in Raigad and ghat areas of Pune and Satara districts in the next 16 hours and an orange alert for Mumbai

title: AI and biomanufacturing: can India’s policies match its ambitions?
content: When an AI model is used to control a bioreactor, how do we know it’s reliable? Who checks that the data it was trained on is representative of India’s diverse conditions, or that it won’t make a catastrophic error if something unexpected happens? These aren’t just technical questions. They are matters of public trust and safety

title: CPI (Maoist) condemns Operation Kagar, calls for bandh in TG, A.P. on June 20
content: CPI (Maoist) calls for bandh in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh on June 20 against Operation Kagar killings

title: FLO’s rural skill centre to empower women opened in Bhongir
content: The objective behind setting up of the centre is to transform lives of rural women by equipping them with employable skills and entrepreneurial capabilities

title: Opinion: Opinion | What's Behind China's Growing Military Aggression? A 'White Paper' Has Clues
content: While it may be difficult to discern the motivations behind Beijing's actions, some clues are contained in the Chinese white paper on national security that was unveiled for the first time recently.

title: Anti-Terror Watchdog FATF's Rare Acknowledgement On Pahalgam Attack
content: The United Nations' terror watchdog has expressed grave concern over the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, in which 26 people were killed.

title: Bangladesh Directs Fugitive Leader Sheikh Hasina To Return To Face Trial
content: Bangladesh's war crimes court ordered fugitive ex-leader Sheikh Hasina on Monday to return to face trial on charges amounting to crimes against humanity.

title: Monsoon Back On Track, Heatwave To Ease, Says Weather Officials
content: Monsoon has revived after stalling for more than a fortnight, and rains are set to cover central parts of the country this week, bringing relief from the heatwave in the grain-growing northern plains, two senior weather officials said.

title: High-Level Panel Holds Review Meet To Discuss Air India Plane Crash
content: A high-level committee meeting was convened in Delhi today to review the circumstances surrounding the recent air crash tragedy.

title: "Outrageous": Israel Slams France After 4 Weapons Stands Shut At Paris Airshow
content: France shut down the four main Israeli company stands at the Paris Airshow for refusing to remove offensive weapons from display, in a move condemned by Israel and highlighting tensions between the traditional allies.

title: "Outrageous" Israel Slams France After 4 Weapons Stands Shut At Paris Airshow
content: France shut down the four main Israeli company stands at the Paris Airshow for refusing to remove offensive weapons from display, in a move condemned by Israel and highlighting tensions between the traditional allies.

title: Air India Crash: Trainee Doctor's Help May Have Kept Death Count Low
content: At least 270 died when the Air India flight crashed into the campus of a medical college in Ahmedabad shortly after takeoff. Only one passenger among the 242 aboard survived.

title: On Camera, Woman Repeatedly Hits Rapido Driver, Then He Slaps Her
content: A Rapido bike taxi rider was detained, and a police case filed against him after he was seen on camera slapping a woman passenger following an argument between the two over alleged rash driving in Bengaluru on Friday.

title: No Radars, Weather Updates Behind Rise In Uttarakhand Chopper Crashes
content: Sunday's chopper crash in Uttarakhand was the fifth helicopter accident in the last six weeks that has triggered outrage and concern among people and has sent officials scrambling for answers.

title: 2 Senior Officials Of Kedarnath Helicopter Firm Charged For Negligence After Crash
content: Two senior officials of helicopter service operating firm Aryan Aviation Private Ltd have been booked for alleged negligence leading to the chopper crash near Kedarnath that killed all seven on board, including a two-year-old and the pilot.

title: Raja Raghuvanshi Murder Weapon Found, Cops Say He Tried To Fight Back
content: The weapon used to murder Indore-based businessman Raja Raghuvanshi, while he was on his honeymoon in Meghalaya, has been recovered.

title: No Further Damage At Iranian Enrichment Facilities Post Israel Attack: UN
content: UN nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi provided an update on Monday on the situation at Iran's nuclear facilities after Israel launched military strikes and said there was no sign of further damage at the Natanz or Fordow enrichment sites.

title: Students Shifted Out Of Tehran, J&K Parents Thank PM Modi
content: After four sleepless nights, the Qadri family in uptown Srinagar has got some relief. Their son and daughter, students in a medical college in Tehran who got stranded there amid heavy bombing, have finally been evacuated.

title: PM Modi Concludes Landmark Cyprus Visit, Leaves For Canada To Attend G7 Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday wrapped up his landmark two-day visit to Cyprus and left for Canada where he will be attending the 51st G7 Summit in Kananaskis, Alberta, on Tuesday.

title: Bike Taxis Come To Halt In Karnataka As High Court Ban Kicks In
content: Bike taxi services operated by app-based aggregators came to a standstill in Karnataka on Monday following the High Court's directive to suspend operations.

title: "Go Back To Your Country," Bengaluru Driver Told Woman Before Slapping Her
content: A video showing a Rapido bike taxi driver assaulting a woman passenger in Bengaluru's Jayanagar has gone viral on social media.

title: Watch: 50-Year-Old UP Man Attempts To Kiss Snake For Reel, Bitten On Tongue
content: A 50-year-old man is battling for his life after a snake bit him on his tongue as he attempted to kiss the reptile, reportedly to create a reel for social media.

title: Iran Parliament Preparing Bill To Leave Non-Proliferation Treaty: Report
content: Iranian parliamentarians are preparing a bill that could push Tehran toward exiting the nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty, the foreign ministry said on Monday, while reiterating Tehran's official stance against developing nuclear weapons.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The IMF-Shaped Irony In Pakistan's Massive Defence Budget Hike
content: The Pakistani defence budget retains its opacity. Neither the International Monetary Fund (IMF) nor the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has been able to persuade Pakistan to be a little more transparent to its own people.

title: Shohei Ohtani to get back on the mound, Giancarlo Stanton returns this week
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . all seven of Monday's games are evening affairs, with the first pitch at 6:40 p.m. ET when the Miami Marlins host the Philadelphia Phillies .

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and the lost art of the midrange jumper
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander goes off for 35 points to help the Oklahoma City Thunder come from behind . the 6-foot-5, 215-pound guard popped the defender with a strong forearm across the "INDIANA" on his chest, a forceful blow to put him on his pants in the paint .

title: Eagles' Saquon Barkley changes offseason approach as he enters his 'prime'
content: a chorus of confidants is advising him to take a more measured approach to his training . he says he's not retiring anytime soon . barkley says the majority of those days is just mobility, conditioning, doing all the things .

title: Can Calvin Pickard backstop another Cup Final rally for the Oilers?
content: goaltender Calvin Pickard has helped save Edmonton from back-breaking deficits in this NHL postseason . pickard has forged a career excelling in secondary roles, the classic blue-collar contributor exemplifying work ethic and a straightforward mentality . he's just a normal guy, says kane, who's popular in his room .

title: NFC North roundtable: Who is the QB with the most to prove?
content: the NFC North is the only division in which all four teams have at least a 35% chance to make the playoffs, according to ESPN Analytics . the .662 win percentage was posted by a division since 2002 . all three teams were eliminated in their first game .
